1. ALL EQUIPMENT AND INSTRUMENT TAG NUMBERS ON THIS DRAWING ARE PREFIXED BY AREA
    CODE (14) AND PLANT AREA (01) UNLESS SPECIFIED OTHERWISE.
2. REFER TO ADCO DOC NO. 30.99.00.0103.1 ALONG WITH THE P&ID-TYPICAL PIG RECEIVER
    SYSTEM FOR MULTIPHASE FLOW TOWARDS DESIGN REQUIREMENT.
3. MOVS ARE ONLY OPERATED LOCALLY VIA INTEGRAL ACTUATOR CONTROLS.
4. LOW RANGE (0-1 BARG) PRESSURE INDICATOR SHALL BE INSTALLED BUT PRESSURE RATED TO
    PIPELINE DESIGN PRESSURE AND SHALL BE LOCATED AT A MINIMUM DISTANCE FROM PIG TRAP
    DOOR SO THAT IT IS EASILY VISIBLE
5. PURGING CONNECTION IS LOCATED NEAR END CLOSURE TO ALLOW PURGING
    AND/OR FLUSHING THE FULL LENGTH OF BARREL WITH INERT GAS / INHIBITED WATER.
    ALL UTILITY CONNECTIONS ARE PROVIDED WITH FACILITY FOR QUICK CONNECT/DISCONNECT.
6. A PORTABLE DRIP TRAY (OF APPROX 5% VOLUME OF PIG TRAP) IS PROVIDED DIRECTLY
    UNDERNEATH  END CLOSURE OF PIG TRAP TO CONTAIN ANY SPILLED HYDROCARBON DURING
    OPENING OF TRAP DOOR.
7. RODDING POINT.
8. THE CORROSION MONITORING ACCESS FITTINGS SHOULD BE SITUATED SUFFICIENTLY
    DOWNSTREAM THE CHEMICAL INJECTION ACCESS FITTINGS BY TYPICALLY 10 PIPE DIAMETERS
    AND SHALL BE IN

1. ALL EQUIPMENT AND INSTRUMENT TAG NUMBERS ON THE DRAWING ARE PREFIXED BY THE
    AREA CODE (14) AND PLANT AREA CODE (01) UNLESS SPECIFIED OTHERWISE.
2. DELETED.
3. DISCREPANCY ALRAM PROVIDED TO INDICATE INADVERTENT OPENING OF BDV DURING
    NORMAL OPERATION.
4. HIGH HIGH PRESSURE IN EXPORT GAS KOD WILL CLOSE SDV-3601-01 AND SDV-3601-02. SET
    POINT SHALL BE IN LINE WITH ASAB HP HEADER HH TRIP VALUE.
5. LINE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR 2 PHASE DUE TO ANY LEVEL FAILURE IN KOD.
6. ROTAMETER SHALL BE POSITIONED VERTICALLY UP IN FLOW DIRECTION.
7. 3D STRAIGHT RUN LENGTH REQUIREMENT AT THE UPSTREAM OF INLET NOZZLE.
8. 5D STRAIGHT LENGTH REQUIREMENT AT UPSTREASM OF CHECK VALVE.

1. ALL THE EQUIPMENT AND INSTRUMENT TAG NUMBERS ON THIS DRAWING ARE  PREFIXED BY
    AREA CODE (16) AND PLANT AREA CODE (01) UNLESS SPECIFIED  OTHERWISE.
2. REFER TO ADNOC ONSHORE ENGINEERING SPEC. DOC NO.30.99.00.0103
3. MOVS CAN ONLY BE OPERATED LOCALLY VIA INTEGRAL ACTUATOR CONTROLS.
4. LOW RANGE (0-1 BARG) PRESSURE INDICATOR SHALL BE INSTALLED BUT PRESSURE RATED
    TO PIPELINE DESIGN PRESSURE AND SHALL BE LOCATED AT A MINIMUM DISTANCE FROM
    PIG TRAP DOOR SO THAT IT IS EASILY VISIBLE.
5. THE CC, CP AND BP ACCESS FITTINGS SHOULD BE SITUATED SUFFICIENTLY DOWNSTREAM
    THE CHEMICAL INJECTION ACCESS FITTINGS BY TYPICALLY 10 PIPE DIAMETERS AND SHALL
    BE INSTALLED FLUSH MOUTED AT 6 O'CLOCK POSITION
6. RODDING POINT.
7. VALVE PROVIDED WITH INCHING FACILITY WITH MIN MECHANICAL FLOW STOP (99%).
8. DELETED.
9. DELETED.
10. MULTIPHASE FLOW, ADEQUATE PIPING SUPPORTS PROVIDED.
11. OPERATIONAL PROCEDURES ARE WRITTEN SUCH THAT THERE IS ALWAYS  AN OPEN ROUTE
      TO THE CDS.
12. SEQUENTIAL KEY INTERLOCKING SYSTEM TO REGULATE OPERATION OF PIG TRAP VALVES AND
     TRAP DOOR SHALL BE PROVIDED FOR SAFE HANDLING. REFER TO ADNOC DOCUMENT NO.
      ES-30-90-00-0103-1 FOR SAFETY INTERLOCKING SYSTEM.
13. PURGE LOCATION NEAR PIG-TRAP VALVE OR END CLOSURE TO ALLOW PURGING AND/OR
      F

insights.notation_system: SFILES 2.0 (Simplified Flowsheet Input Line Entry System)
insights.representation: Text-based flowsheet representation similar to SMILES for molecules

key_concepts.heat_integration: Heat integration tagged with curly braces { }
key_concepts.control: Control structure represented with special notation
